_header: All be it so I seld have of you sight
_description:
Death a way out for the lover,. translated from the French of Charles d’Orléans (Champollion-Figeac (1842)
XChampollion-Figeac, Aime. Les Poesies du duc Charles d’Orleans. Paris, 1842, 62) — three 9-line stanzas and 6-line Envoy

BLHar682.First Lines:
ALl be hit so y selde haue of yow sightYet mowe ye thynke that y am
                    yowris ywis…
BLHar682.Last Lines: …To gyue me so no more O welawaySaue only this the verry deth aloon
BLHar682.Facsimiles:
